A little boy saw the bee and thought, "I want to be friends with the bee!" So, the boy let the bee play with the ball. They had so much fun together. They laughed and played all day long.
But then, something unexpected happened. The bee touched the ball and it changed colors! It turned from red to blue. The boy and the bee were very surprised. They found out that when the bee touched things, they changed colors. They had more fun changing colors of many things. And they became best friends forever.

A girl named Lily went to the truck. She said, "I want to see the big olives!" Her mom said, "Okay, let's go!" They walked to the truck and saw the big green olives. Lily was very happy.
But then, something strange happen. The big green olives started to talk! The olives said, "Hello! We are not normal olives. We are from a far away place." The people in the town were very surprised. They had never seen talking olives before. The talking olives became friends with the people in the town, and they all lived happily together

Avery went to the park with her mom one sunny day. She saw some strange things there.
Avery's mom said, "Avery, look. Do you know what that is?"
Avery looked and said, "It's a weird baseball."
"Yes, it's a weird baseball," said her mom. "Do you know what this means?"
Avery smiled and said, "It means I can play!"
Avery and her mom both had so much fun playing baseball. They played for a long time, and Avery even hit the ball at one point.

A bird flew down to her and said, "That's a cup. See how nice and round it is?"
Susie smiled and asked, "Can I take it home?"
The bird said, "I think that's a good idea. A cup can be very useful."
So Susie took the cup home and put it in her room. She saw that it was very pretty and it made her room look good. She was so happy and used the cup every day.

A hurricane is coming!" Tim's mom said. "Come inside, Tim!" Tim and his friends went inside their houses to be safe.
The hurricane made a big mess outside. When it was over, Tim and his friends went out to clean up. They picked up sticks and leaves. Tim said, "Let's work together and make our town organized again!" And they did. They loved to help each other and make their town beautiful again.

"A cloud-bird? What's that?" Lila wondered.
"A cloud-bird is a bird that lives in the clouds. It can fly very fast and very far. It can make rain and snow and thunder. It's very special." Sam explained.
"Wow, I wish I could see a cloud-bird up close. Do you think it would be friendly?" Lila said.
"Maybe. Maybe we can be friends with the cloud-bird. Maybe we can soar with it." Sam said.
They both smiled and imagined flying with the cloud-bird.

A little girl named Sue saw Tim and came over to play. She asked, "Can I keep digging with you?" Tim said, "Yes, we can dig together!" They kept digging the hole, making it even deeper.
As they dug, they found something shiny in the hole. They dug around it and pulled it out. It was a big, shiny key! Tim and Sue looked at each other, surprised. They did not expect to find a key in the sand. They decided to keep digging and see if they could find what the key unlocks.

A little girl named Lisa had an idea. She took her ice cream and walked up to the frog. She gave the frog her ice cream. The frog ate the ice cream, and it was very happy. The frog then jumped off the road, and the traffic started moving again. Tom was so proud of Lisa, and he gave her a new ice cream. From that day on, the town loved Tom's ice cream even more, and they all became good friends with the big, green frog.

A little boy named Tim saw a big red balloon. He wanted to hold it. Tim asked the balloon man, "Can I have the big red balloon, please?" The balloon man said, "Yes, you can, but be careful not to release it!"
Tim held the balloon tight, but then something unexpected happened. A tiny bird flew by and pecked the balloon. "Pop!" The balloon burst, and the bird flew away. Tim was sad, but then he saw a big rainbow in the sky. The rainbow made him smile, and he forgot about the balloon.

The bird and Spot became friends. They took turns kicking the cap and having fun. At the end of the day, they were both tired but happy. Spot learned that it's always good to share and make new friends.
